text: Lypsinka (born John Epperson on 24 April 1955) is an American drag queen, actor, pianist, vocalist, and writer. Epperson was born in Hazelhurst, Mississippi. He moved to New York City in 1978. He did drag gigs on the side at various nightspots. "Lypsinka" first appeared in 1988 in New York as a late-night addition to Charles Busch's Vampire Lesbians of Sodom. Lypsinka has appeared in solo shows Off-Broadway. Epperson says Lypsinka was modelled on Dolores Gray.Pela, Robert L. Kind of a drag. Lypsinka is much more than a drag queen. Phoenix News Times, Apr 8, 2004. For his show Lypsinka! The Boxed Set, Epperson won the Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award for Best Sound Design, the LA Weekly Theater Award for Best Solo Performance, and the Helen Hayes Award for Best Non-resident Production in 2003. == References == Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Mississippi Category:American LGBT writers Category:American pianists Category:Drag queens Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT singers Category:Singers from Mississippi Category:Writers from Mississippi
